milestone: China reports first COVID-19 death
First confirmed COVID-19 case in the U.S.
The W.H.O. declares a global health emergency
First reported COVID-19 death in the U.S.
First COVID-19 case in New York State
NY Governor Andrew Cuomo declares a state of emergency
NYC issues guidelines to avoid densely packed buses, subways, or trains
Governor Cuomo orders containment zone in New Rochelle from March 12 to 25
Events with more than 500 people must be cancelled or postponed
Broadway shuts down
President Trump declares a national emergency
First two COVID-19 deaths in NYS
C.D.C. recommendeds no gatherings of 50+ in the U.S.
NYC public schools close
NYC bars and restaurants close, except for delivery
NYS on Pause Program begins, all non-essential workers must stay home
USNS Comfort arrives in NYC
President signs the CARES Act
U.S. reaches the most COVID-19 cases in the world
Governor Cuomo halts all nonessential construction sites in NYS
NYC passes 1,000 COVID-19 deaths
Governor Cuomo extends NYS's stay-at-home order and school closures to April 29
NYS records more COVID19 cases than any other country (besides U.S.)
Governor Cuomo requires face masks or coverings in public places
Governor Cuomo extends NYS's stay-at-home order and school closures to May 15
Governor Cuomo announces NYC subway closures from 1 a.m. to 5 a.m.
Governor Cuomo closes all schools for the remainder of the academic year
Governor Cuomo extends PAUSE order to June 6, but will allow counties to open by May 15 if they meet qualifications
Governor Cuomo extends PAUSE order to May 28 for NYC and regions not meeting requirements to reopen
State of emergency for NYS extended to June 13
Governor Cuomo allows drive-in theaters, landscaping, and low-risk recreational activities to reopen
Governor Cuomo allows gatherings of up to 10 people with social distancing
U.S. COVID-19 deaths pass 100,000
NYC begins Phase 1 reopening
NY, NJ and CT require travelers to self-quarantine for 14 days if traveling from hot spots
NYC begins phase 2 of reopening
U.S. COVID-19 deaths surpass 130,000
NYC begins Phase 3 of reopening, without indoor dining
NYC begins Phase 4 reopening, excluding malls, museums and indoor dining/bars
NYC reports 227,517 COVID-19 cases and 22,934 deaths to date
NYC's health commissioner, Dr. Oxiris Barbot, resigns after voicing “deep disappointment” with Mayor Bill de Blasio’s handling of the pandemic
Gyms in NYC reopen, but indoor group workouts and pools stay closed
Sheriff deputies begin stopping buses headed to Port Authority from hot spots, requiring quarantine forms to be signed
Malls in NYC reopen at 50% capacity with no indoor dining. Casinos reopen across NYS at 25% capacity.
Mayor de Blasio furloughs his City Hall staff, including himself
Pre-K and advanced special-needs classes begin in-person learning in NYC
The union representing NYC principals and school administrators delivers a unanimous "no confidence" vote days before students are set to return to schools
Elementary students return to public school classrooms across NYC
Indoor dining in NYC resumes with a 25% occupancy limit
NYC middle and high schools begin in-person learning.
President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump test positive for coronavirus
Mayor de Blasio says all schools and non-essential businesses will close in nine zip codes in Brooklyn and Queens, if approved by the state
NYC reports 252,000 COVID-19 cases and 23,861 deaths to date
40 U.S. hotspots are on the New York quarantine list
New York tops a half-million confirmed COVID-19 cases
New COVID-19 restrictions go into effect, including curfews on restaurants and gyms, and limited gatherings in private homes of 10 people
NYC schools switch to all-remote
Restrictions on indoor dining are renewed in NYC
NYC elementary schools reopen for in-person learning
Cuomo suspends indoor dining in NYC, and the U.S. administers its first COVID-19 vaccine
Restaurants reopen indoor dining at 25% capacity
New Yorkers with underlying conditions become eligible for COVID-19 vaccine
NYC middle schools resume in-person learning
NYC movie theaters reopen
NYC high schools reopen for in-person learning
New Yorkers age 30 and up are eligible for a vaccine
New Yorkers age 16 and up are eligible for a vaccine
